newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-BRAVES BEAT DODGERS TO REACH CHAMPIONSHIP SERIES.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-BRAVES BEAT DODGERS TO REACH CHAMPIONSHIP SERIES.

text.p: The Atlanta Braves, behind Tom Glavine's strong pitching and Chipper Jones' two-run homer, reached their fifth straight National League Championship Series on a 5-2 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers Saturday.

The Braves once again used strong pitching and the long ball to complete a three-game division series sweep of the Dodgers. Atlanta hit five homers in the three games and held Los Angeles to just five runs.

The Braves jumped on Los Angeles starter Hideo Nomo for five runs, five hits and five walks in 3-2/3 innings. Nomo had dominated the Braves in three regular season starts, going 2-0 with a 1.61 ERA in 22-1/3 innings.
Glavine scattered five hits and three walks while striking out seven in 6-2/3 innings. Mark Wohlers retired all four batters he faced and saved every game of the series.
"I was borderline," Glavine said, but "my changeup was good today."
Asked his reaction to reaching the NLCS again, he said: "I was surprised. The margin of error is very small."
